thread.title: Social Media Reacts to Biden's Decision Not to Run for President
thread.title_full: Social Media Reacts to Biden's Decision Not to Run for President

author: DAMIAN GEMINDER
title: Social Media Reacts to Biden's Decision Not to Run for President
text:
Privacy Policy | More Newsletters AFP/Getty Images Vice President Joe Biden, flanked by President Barack Obama, speaks in the Rose Garden at the White House on October 21, 2015, in Washington, D.C. Biden announced that he is not running for president. Vice President Joe Biden announced on Wednesday that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President of the United States. Biden said that the window of opportunity to mount a realistic campaign had closed, putting an end to months of speculation that Biden might make a third run for the presidency. Biden implored his party's eventual nominee to run on Obama's record and vowed to remain a visible figure during the election process. "While I will not be a candidate, I will not be silent," Biden said. Social media users will not be silent either. Reaction to Biden's announcement was swift and ranged from the laudatory to the laugh-worthy: . @VP is a good friend and a great man. Today and always, inspired by his optimism and commitment to change the world for the better. -H â€” Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) October 21, 2015 
Joe Biden, a good friend, has made the decision that he feels is best for himself, his family and the country. I thank...
